passage_text: verb. To fidget is defined as to make small movements, often because you are restless, nervous or uncomfortable. An example of fidget is a child who moves around a lot in his chair on a plane because he is restless and bored.
Definition of FIDGET. 1. : uneasiness or restlessness as shown by nervous movements —usually used in plural. 2. [2fidget] : one that fidgets. See fidget defined for kids. ADVERTISEMENT.
Full Definition of FIDGET. intransitive verb. : to move or act restlessly or nervously. transitive verb. : to cause to move or act

Fidgeting. Fidgeting is the act of moving about restlessly. Fidgeting may be a result of nervousness, agitation, boredom or a combination of these. It may be a result of genes and is often an unconscious act. Fidgeting may involve playing with one's fingers, hair, or items of clothing. A common act of fidgeting is to bounce one's leg repeatedly.
